propositions.text: The document is a review of the novel "The Metamorph" by the author Na Duo.
It focuses on analyzing the plot, characters, and thematic elements of the novel.
The review is structured into several sections: Introduction, Reviews of "The Metamorph" (1) and (2), and a Preface.
The Preface contains a news report about an archaeological discovery and the author's personal reflection on it.
The review highlights Na Duo's characteristic use of news items to open his narratives.
The novel "The Metamorph" features supernatural elements and characters with unusual abilities.
These elements include a cat that survives being run over by a truck, cockroaches with separable bodies, and fish living in sand.
The story introduces characters like Su Ying, who has a history of mental illness and a connection to the mysterious X organization.
Another key character is Ruan Xiuwen, a researcher from the X organization, whose reactions are unusual.
The existence of 'Haitians' (海地人) is a central mystery.
Su Ying is presented as the female protagonist, a beautiful but nervous woman involved with the supernatural events.
Shui Sheng is described as the most capable among the 'Haitians,' possessing strong willpower.
Ruan Xiuwen, an X organization researcher, possesses a mysterious aura due to his family background.
Lu Yun is a frequently appearing character who is portrayed as powerful and helpful, though her interactions can be intimidating.
Na Duo's works, including "The Metamorph," are not horror novels but explore themes of the unknown and question established knowledge.
The review lists various works by Na Duo and their corresponding supernatural elements (e.g., illusions in "The Man of the Fiery Heart," wormholes in "Iron Bull Reappears").
Humor is identified as an essential element in Na Duo's narratives.
The review suggests that Na Duo might have a touch of narcissism, evidenced by the descriptions of characters resembling him as handsome.
This is inferred from the description of Shui Sheng and Su Ying as a perfect couple and the physical similarity of characters like Fan Zhe to Na Duo.
Love is presented as the core theme of "The Metamorph."
The love in "The Metamorph" is described as unique, an 'other's love' that transcends impossibility.
This love strengthens Shui Sheng's resolve and Su Ying's belief in 'Haitians'.
The news report in the preface details a significant archaeological discovery at the "Zhidanyuan" site in Shanghai.
The discovery is a Yuan Dynasty stone sluice, considered the largest and most exquisite of its kind in China.
It challenges the notion that Shanghai was merely a small fishing village before modern times.
The site was accidentally discovered during construction, leading to a careful excavation.
The author, as a journalist, had prior experience with the Zhidanyuan archaeological site, having been prevented from reporting on it earlier.
The author recounts a series of bizarre and unbelievable events he experienced after moving into Zhidanyuan.
He is forced to move out of his apartment due to building issues and borrows an apartment from his colleague Shui Sheng in Zhidanyuan.
The first strange event involves a black cat that is run over by a truck but seems to disappear afterwards.
The author witnesses the cat being crushed, but its body is gone when he checks again.
Upon settling into Shui Sheng's apartment, the author discovers Shui Sheng's private collection of adult magazines and films.
The author, Na Duo, is writing the manuscript about a terrifying experience he had a year prior.
He hears a strange cat's cry and sees a black silhouette, reinforcing his belief about the cat.
He encounters a beautiful, long-haired woman by the construction site at night.
This woman is later revealed to be Su Ying, a small-time advertising model and university student.
The author helps Su Ying clean up her flooded apartment due to her habit of falling asleep in the bath.
Su Ying exhibits an unusual fondness for being submerged in water.
The author, a journalist, feels pressured to find a new story and decides to investigate the Zhidanyuan archaeological site.
The archaeological team leader, Zhang Qiang, informs the author that there has been little progress and no significant discoveries.
Zhang Qiang suggests the author return the next day when a renowned archaeology expert from Beijing will arrive to re-examine the site's age and purpose.

hierarchy.structure: The document is structured as a critical review of a novel, incorporating elements of a news report and personal narrative. It begins with an introduction to the author's style, followed by detailed reviews of the novel's content, a preface that includes a news item about an archaeological discovery and the author's personal connection to it, and then a narrative detailing the supernatural experiences that form the basis of the novel, all framed within the author's journalistic perspective.
